title: Insertion sort
content:
1
00:00:01,240 --> 00:00:03,102
Welcome back everyone. In this

2
00:00:03,126 --> 00:00:04,790
video, let's take a look at the

3
00:00:04,830 --> 00:00:06,686
second sorting algorithm, which

4
00:00:06,718 --> 00:00:09,806
is insertion sort. The problem

5
00:00:09,878 --> 00:00:11,610
statement remains the same.

6
00:00:12,430 --> 00:00:15,118
Given an array of integers sort,

7
00:00:15,174 --> 00:00:17,966
the array sorting can either be

8
00:00:17,998 --> 00:00:20,558
ascending or descending. For

9
00:00:20,574 --> 00:00:23,486
example, if we have an array of

10
00:00:23,558 --> 00:00:26,928
five integers, passing the array

11
00:00:26,984 --> 00:00:28,856
into insertionsort function

12
00:00:28,968 --> 00:00:30,936
should return the same array in

13
00:00:30,968 --> 00:00:34,024
ascending order. Let's first

14
00:00:34,072 --> 00:00:35,504
understand the idea behind

15
00:00:35,592 --> 00:00:38,776
insertion sort. With insertion

16
00:00:38,808 --> 00:00:41,440
sort, you virtually split the

17
00:00:41,480 --> 00:00:43,576
array into a sorted and an

18
00:00:43,608 --> 00:00:46,864
unsorted part. Since one item by

19
00:00:46,912 --> 00:00:49,584
definition is always sorted, we

20
00:00:49,632 --> 00:00:51,504
assume that the first element is

21
00:00:51,552 --> 00:00:53,754
sorted and remaining elements

22
00:00:53,842 --> 00:00:57,106
are unsorted. You then select

23
00:00:57,178 --> 00:00:59,442
an unsorted element and compare

24
00:00:59,506 --> 00:01:00,842
with all the elements in the

25
00:01:00,866 --> 00:01:03,594
sorted part. If the elements in

26
00:01:03,602 --> 00:01:05,858
the sorted part is smaller than

27
00:01:05,874 --> 00:01:08,138
the selected element, proceed to

28
00:01:08,154 --> 00:01:09,810
the next element in the unsorted

29
00:01:09,850 --> 00:01:13,306
part. Else shift larger elements

30
00:01:13,378 --> 00:01:15,130
in the sorted part towards the

31
00:01:15,170 --> 00:01:18,562
right. You then insert the

32
00:01:18,586 --> 00:01:20,114
selected element at the right

33
00:01:20,162 --> 00:01:22,638
index, ensuring the sorted part

34
00:01:22,734 --> 00:01:25,890
remains that way. Finally,

35
00:01:26,670 --> 00:01:28,886
repeat the above steps for all

36
00:01:28,918 --> 00:01:30,374
the unsorted elements in the

37
00:01:30,422 --> 00:01:33,758
array. Of course, these points

38
00:01:33,854 --> 00:01:35,246
might be difficult to

39
00:01:35,278 --> 00:01:36,886
understand, so let me help you

40
00:01:36,918 --> 00:01:38,610
visualize with an example.

41
00:01:40,790 --> 00:01:42,502
Consider the array from our

42
00:01:42,566 --> 00:01:45,846
example. Minus 628,

43
00:01:45,958 --> 00:01:48,882
minus two and four. I've omitted

44
00:01:48,906 --> 00:01:50,466
the comma as it gets a bit too

45
00:01:50,498 --> 00:01:53,770
crowded. Here is how insertion

46
00:01:53,810 --> 00:01:56,874
sort works. You begin by

47
00:01:56,922 --> 00:01:58,578
assuming the first element in

48
00:01:58,594 --> 00:02:00,950
the array is already sorted.

49
00:02:01,530 --> 00:02:03,330
Remaining four elements are

50
00:02:03,370 --> 00:02:06,874
unsorted. You start at index

51
00:02:06,962 --> 00:02:09,074
one, which is the first unsorted

52
00:02:09,122 --> 00:02:11,258
element. Let's store it in a

53
00:02:11,274 --> 00:02:12,914
variable called number to

54
00:02:12,962 --> 00:02:15,670
insert, or NTI for short.

55
00:02:16,830 --> 00:02:18,614
You compare it with the sorted

56
00:02:18,662 --> 00:02:20,598
elements on its left to see if

57
00:02:20,614 --> 00:02:23,846
it is out of order. We have one

58
00:02:23,918 --> 00:02:25,798
sorted element which is minus

59
00:02:25,854 --> 00:02:29,610
six. Lets represent that as se

60
00:02:30,070 --> 00:02:33,326
sorted element. For short. We

61
00:02:33,358 --> 00:02:35,118
check if the sorted element is

62
00:02:35,174 --> 00:02:36,654
greater than the number to

63
00:02:36,702 --> 00:02:39,862
insert. Is minus six greater

64
00:02:39,926 --> 00:02:43,220
than 20. The answer is no.

65
00:02:43,640 --> 00:02:46,200
In that case, place 20 to the

66
00:02:46,240 --> 00:02:49,472
right of minus six. Of course

67
00:02:49,536 --> 00:02:51,040
there is no change in our

68
00:02:51,080 --> 00:02:53,952
scenario as 20 is already to the

69
00:02:53,976 --> 00:02:55,620
right of minus six.

70
00:02:56,800 --> 00:02:59,472
Minus six and 20 now form the

71
00:02:59,496 --> 00:03:03,000
sorted part of the array. Next

72
00:03:03,080 --> 00:03:05,800
we pick eight, which is from the

73
00:03:05,840 --> 00:03:07,700
unsorted part of the array.

74
00:03:08,070 --> 00:03:10,230
Let's store eight as number to

75
00:03:10,270 --> 00:03:12,742
insert. We compare it with the

76
00:03:12,766 --> 00:03:15,750
sorted elements first. We start

77
00:03:15,830 --> 00:03:19,486
at 20. Is 20 greater than

78
00:03:19,558 --> 00:03:24,158
eight? Yes, it is. So shift 21

79
00:03:24,214 --> 00:03:27,150
position to the right. We now

80
00:03:27,190 --> 00:03:30,358
have 20 twice, but that is ok as

81
00:03:30,414 --> 00:03:31,870
eight is stored in a variable

82
00:03:31,950 --> 00:03:34,052
called number to insert a and we

83
00:03:34,076 --> 00:03:35,960
haven't lost track of it.

84
00:03:37,180 --> 00:03:40,772
After 20, the next

85
00:03:40,836 --> 00:03:43,884
sorted element is minus six. Is

86
00:03:43,932 --> 00:03:46,200
minus six greater than eight?

87
00:03:46,540 --> 00:03:49,548
No. So place eight which is the

88
00:03:49,564 --> 00:03:52,268
number to insert one position to

89
00:03:52,284 --> 00:03:55,484
the right of minus six. Our

90
00:03:55,532 --> 00:03:57,324
sorted part of the array is now

91
00:03:57,412 --> 00:03:59,960
minus six, eight and 20.

92
00:04:01,250 --> 00:04:03,058
The next unsorted element is

93
00:04:03,114 --> 00:04:06,018
minus two. Compare it with

94
00:04:06,074 --> 00:04:07,890
sorted part and shift the sorted

95
00:04:07,930 --> 00:04:11,386
elements as necessary. Is 20

96
00:04:11,498 --> 00:04:14,834
greater than minus two? Yes. So

97
00:04:14,882 --> 00:04:18,402
shift to the right. Next is

98
00:04:18,466 --> 00:04:20,310
eight greater than minus two?

99
00:04:20,690 --> 00:04:22,910
Yes. So shift to the right.

100
00:04:23,850 --> 00:04:27,266
Next is minus six greater than

101
00:04:27,298 --> 00:04:30,368
minus two? No. So place minus

102
00:04:30,424 --> 00:04:32,900
two to the right of minus six.

103
00:04:33,680 --> 00:04:35,824
Our sorted part is now minus

104
00:04:35,872 --> 00:04:38,740
six, minus two, eight and 20.

105
00:04:40,120 --> 00:04:42,192
Finally, the unsorted element is

106
00:04:42,256 --> 00:04:45,352
four. Compare again with the

107
00:04:45,376 --> 00:04:47,080
sorted part which lies to the

108
00:04:47,120 --> 00:04:50,580
left. Is 20 greater than four?

109
00:04:51,080 --> 00:04:53,820
Yes. So shift 20 to the right.

110
00:04:55,730 --> 00:04:58,390
Next is eight greater than four.

111
00:04:58,890 --> 00:05:01,070
Yes. So shift to the right.

112
00:05:02,170 --> 00:05:04,530
Next is minus two greater than

113
00:05:04,570 --> 00:05:07,706
four? No. So place four to the

114
00:05:07,738 --> 00:05:11,938
right of minus two. Our sorted

115
00:05:11,994 --> 00:05:14,434
array is now minus six, minus

116
00:05:14,482 --> 00:05:18,346
two, four, eight and 20. We have

117
00:05:18,378 --> 00:05:20,210
reached the end of the array,

118
00:05:20,290 --> 00:05:22,248
which means I the entire array

119
00:05:22,304 --> 00:05:25,848
is now sorted. This is how the

120
00:05:25,904 --> 00:05:28,380
insertion sort algorithm works.

121
00:05:30,000 --> 00:05:31,480
Alright, if you've understood

122
00:05:31,520 --> 00:05:33,424
the algorithm, now is the time

123
00:05:33,472 --> 00:05:35,152
to pause and implement the

124
00:05:35,176 --> 00:05:37,408
solution. If you would like to

125
00:05:37,424 --> 00:05:39,624
solve together, let's do so in

126
00:05:39,632 --> 00:05:40,040
the next video.

title: Thanos - I finally rest
content:
1
00:00:01,440 --> 00:00:02,926
With all six stones, I could

2
00:00:02,958 --> 00:00:05,718
simply snap my fingers. They

3
00:00:05,734 --> 00:00:07,598
would all cease to exist. I call

4
00:00:07,654 --> 00:00:10,210
that mercy.

5
00:00:12,110 --> 00:00:16,450
And then what? I finally rest

6
00:00:17,310 --> 00:00:18,958
and watched the sunrise on a

7
00:00:18,974 --> 00:00:22,414
grateful universe. The hardest

8
00:00:22,462 --> 00:00:24,078
choices require the strongest

title: Queen Charlotte - Do you love me
content:
1
00:00:00,200 --> 00:00:01,838
Do you love me? I'm trying to

2
00:00:01,854 --> 00:00:03,582
protect you. Do you love me? I.

3
00:00:03,686 --> 00:00:06,022
I cannot. We cannot. This

4
00:00:06,046 --> 00:00:07,374
conversation isn't. I cannot do

5
00:00:07,382 --> 00:00:09,294
this. I never wanted to marry

6
00:00:09,462 --> 00:00:11,414
Charlotte. Please stop. Is this

7
00:00:11,462 --> 00:00:12,662
because you do not believe that

8
00:00:12,686 --> 00:00:15,530
I could love you? I do.

9
00:00:18,230 --> 00:00:21,822
I love you, George. I love

10
00:00:21,846 --> 00:00:23,502
you so much that I will do as

11
00:00:23,526 --> 00:00:25,262
you wish. If you do not love me,

12
00:00:25,286 --> 00:00:26,214
all you have to say is that you

13
00:00:26,222 --> 00:00:27,302
do not love me. And I will go.

14
00:00:27,366 --> 00:00:28,366
I will go back to Buckingham

15
00:00:28,398 --> 00:00:29,462
House and we can live our

16
00:00:29,486 --> 00:00:30,422
separate lives and I will have

17
00:00:30,446 --> 00:00:31,898
this baby alone. And I will make

18
00:00:31,934 --> 00:00:33,882
make do and fill my days and

19
00:00:33,906 --> 00:00:35,866
survive all on my own. I will do

20
00:00:35,898 --> 00:00:37,666
that. But first you have to say

21
00:00:37,698 --> 00:00:39,310
that you do not love me.

22
00:00:42,450 --> 00:00:43,874
You have to tell me that I am

23
00:00:43,922 --> 00:00:45,750
utterly alone in this world.

24
00:00:48,530 --> 00:00:52,298
I am a madman. I am a danger in

25
00:00:52,314 --> 00:00:53,274
my mind. There are different

26
00:00:53,322 --> 00:00:54,922
worlds creeping in. The heavens

27
00:00:54,946 --> 00:00:56,282
and the earth collide. I do not

28
00:00:56,306 --> 00:00:57,506
know where I am. Do you love me?

29
00:00:57,538 --> 00:00:58,786
You do not wish a life with me

30
00:00:58,818 --> 00:01:00,792
for yourself? No one wishes you,

31
00:01:00,816 --> 00:01:03,128
George. I will stand with you

32
00:01:03,144 --> 00:01:04,032
between the heavens and the

33
00:01:04,056 --> 00:01:05,392
earth. I will tell you where you

34
00:01:05,416 --> 00:01:07,860
are. Do you love me? I love you.

35
00:01:11,760 --> 00:01:15,912
From the mo. From the

36
00:01:15,936 --> 00:01:17,008
moment I saw you trying to go

37
00:01:17,024 --> 00:01:19,096
over the wall, I have loved you

38
00:01:19,128 --> 00:01:20,328
desperately. I cannot breathe

39
00:01:20,344 --> 00:01:21,456
when you are not near. I love

40
00:01:21,488 --> 00:01:23,976
you, Charlotte. My heart goes.

41
00:01:24,008 --> 00:01:31,790
Your name, our channel.

1
00:00:00,240 --> 00:00:01,217
Hey there my gorgeous friends on

2
00:00:01,241 --> 00:00:02,585
the Internet and welcome to the

3
00:00:02,625 --> 00:00:06,593
ultimate next JS course 142024

4
00:00:06,649 --> 00:00:08,361
edition. I'm so excited. This

5
00:00:08,393 --> 00:00:09,881
has been six months in the

6
00:00:09,913 --> 00:00:12,129
works. So in this one I'm going

7
00:00:12,137 --> 00:00:13,169
to teach you everything from

8
00:00:13,217 --> 00:00:14,369
scratch. We're going to start by

9
00:00:14,417 --> 00:00:16,137
buying a domain. We're going to

10
00:00:16,161 --> 00:00:17,553
deploy an e commerce website

11
00:00:17,609 --> 00:00:19,729
here with next JS14. We're going

12
00:00:19,737 --> 00:00:21,089
to be using drizzle

13
00:00:21,257 --> 00:00:23,529

14
00:00:23,577 --> 00:00:25,361
users. I'll show you how you can

15
00:00:25,393 --> 00:00:27,019

16
00:00:27,097 --> 00:00:28,527
Let me just show you. So this is

17
00:00:28,551 --> 00:00:31,431
running next JS14. We have our e

18

commerce website here. I'll show

19

you how we can statically

20
00:00:34,295 --> 00:00:36,023

21

As you can see, we have reviews

22

23

24

25
00:00:42,455 --> 00:00:43,999

26

27
00:00:45,239 --> 00:00:46,751

28
00:00:46,783 --> 00:00:48,207
link. As you can see, the state

29
00:00:48,271 --> 00:00:50,111

30
00:00:50,143 --> 00:00:52,215

31
00:00:52,295 --> 00:00:53,889
And if I go to the yellow one.

32

There we go. As you can see, we

33
00:00:55,349 --> 00:00:56,997

34
00:00:57,021 --> 00:00:58,093
we can leave. I don't think I

35
00:00:58,109 --> 00:00:59,677

36
00:00:59,861 --> 00:01:01,317
because this product already has

37
00:01:01,341 --> 00:01:03,021

38
00:01:03,053 --> 00:01:04,461

39
00:01:04,493 --> 00:01:05,597

40

00:01:08,117 --> 00:01:09,141
As you can see, we have these

42

00:01:10,605 --> 00:01:12,557
Motion. We're using Chat CN as

44
00:01:12,581 --> 00:01:13,957
well so we can toggle between

45

46
00:01:16,349 --> 00:01:18,501

47
00:01:18,693 --> 00:01:20,877
on these different product

48
00:01:20,941 --> 00:01:21,997
variants as well because it's

49
00:01:22,021 --> 00:01:24,133
the same product so it should

50
00:01:24,189 --> 00:01:26,477
also have that. Let's go back

51
00:01:26,501 --> 00:01:27,901
here. Let me show you something.

52
00:01:28,093 --> 00:01:29,701
We have this tag system as well

53
00:01:29,733 --> 00:01:31,189

54
00:01:31,277 --> 00:01:33,021

55
00:01:33,093 --> 00:01:34,229

56
00:01:34,237 --> 00:01:35,749
much. I added just an example

57

Smart Search with AI. So if I do

78

79
00:02:14,323 --> 00:02:15,841

80

81

How many? 15. It looks like

89

00:02:33,961 --> 00:02:36,205

00:02:50,011 --> 00:02:51,547

We get to create products as

well. And when you create a

title: Arcade

Small town boy in a big arcade.
